item.title: HELOC Payment Jumped From $625 to $1,083 When Draw Period Ended—What I Wish I'd Known
item.description:
For ten years, I paid $625 per month on my HELOC. Interest-only payments during the draw period felt manageable—almost too easy.

Then month 121 arrived, and my payment jumped to $1,083.

The draw period ended. The repayment period began. And suddenly I had a 73% payment increase I wasn’t adequately prepared for.

I knew this was coming—it’s literally how HELOCs work. But understanding conceptually that payments increase is different from experiencing $458 less in your monthly budget.

item.title: My Debt Consolidation Cash-Out Refi Saved Me $712/Month But Increased My Mortgage—Here's the Full Math
item.description:
My cash-out refinance for debt consolidation saved me $712/month in total payments. That sounds amazing, right?

But here’s what the headlines don’t tell you: My mortgage payment increased from $1,345 to $2,180—a $835/month jump.

Wait, how do I save $712/month if my mortgage increased by $835/month? And is taking on a higher mortgage payment worth eliminating high-interest debt?

Here’s the complete math behind my $52,000 debt consolidation through cash-out refi, including the payment tradeoff, total interest savings, credit score improvement, and whether I’d do it again.
